page.title: 12BEDFORD ARMS PUBLIC HOUSE
page.content:
The Bedford Arms stands in a prominent position in Souldrop high street. It has a{lounge}and a{bar}at which a variety of alchoholic and soft drinks are available. For warm days there are seats on the front where you can enjoy your drink and watch people going up and down the street and for those who wish to be more secluded there is a garden at the rear into which drinks may be taken.
The pub has been a feature of the village (on this site) since at least the 1660's. It still maintains its early{character}but unfortunately it lost its thatch in a fire in 1969 and it now has a tiled roof. Most customers nowadays arrive by car and come from Rushden or Bedford for a drink or a{meal}in the country.
